Before I made the transition to software development, I spent my career working in sales and marketing, entrepreneurship and leadership in the US Army.  I have a passion for helping others, and a strong desire to build things that help improve the world. I decided to learn software development so that I can help turn visions into a reality. I feel software development is going to be an in demand skill set for the foreseeable future and I want to position myself to be the most marketable. I want to gain experience by working with startups who want to make the world a better place. I want to be the person who translates their vision into a tangible and functional application. I have spent years building soft skills from my past experiences. As I advance in this field, I feel these skills will help bridge the communication gap between tech and non-tech stakeholders.

projects.title: Gallery of Horns
projects.description: The was the most expanded application I had opportunity to work with. This application was built with React.  The page renders a gallery of images, and the user is able to filter the images via a dropdown menu.  I learned a lot while building this app.

projects.title: Memory Flip
projects.description: This was a group project while I attended Code Fellows.  We created a functional flip card style memory game that helps improve memory recall.  The application was built with HTML, CSS and JavaScript, while using local storage for score tracking

projects.title: Salmon Cookies
projects.description: This was one of the first apps I was working on while attending Code Fellows. I had to develop a front-end implementation for app that shows a graph that updates calculations in real time. This was also my first project using JavaScript.  I've learned a lot!
